title: PM's aide under fire for saying disability benefits should go to 'really disabled people'
text:
PM's aide under fire for saying disability benefits should go to 'really disabled people' PM's aide under fire for saying disability benefits should go to 'really disabled people' A SENIOR advisor to Theresa May has come under fire after he claimed disability benefits should only go to “really disabled people” and not those “taking pills at home, who suffer anxiety”. PUBLISHED: 21:39, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:12, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 TWITTER/GETTY George Freeman is a key aide to Theresa May 
Tory MP George Freeman, who is head of the Number 10 Downing Street policy unit, made the remarks as he defended plans to slash £3.7billion from Personal Independence Payments. 
He told BBC Radio 5 Live: "These tweaks are actually about rolling back some bizarre decisions by benefits tribunals that now mean benefits are being given to people who are taking pills at home, who suffer from anxiety. 
“We want to make sure we get the money to the really disabled people who need it. Related articles
